Forecasting (forecast)

The forecasting module provides the main Forecaster class and integration with different forecasting models.

ARIMA Forecasting

decline_analysis.forecast_arima.forecast_arima(series, horizon=12, order=None, seasonal=False, seasonal_period=12)[source]

Forecast using ARIMA model.

Parameters:

  • series (Series) – Univariate time series with a DateTimeIndex.

  • horizon (int) – Forecast horizon.

  • order (Optional[Tuple[int, int, int]]) – Optional ARIMA (p,d,q) order. If None, uses auto_arima.

  • seasonal (bool) – Whether to include seasonal ARIMA terms.

  • seasonal_period (int) – The seasonal period if seasonal is True.

Return type:

Series

Returns:

Forecasted pandas Series with horizon steps.

Functions

forecast_arima

decline_analysis.forecast_arima.forecast_arima(series, horizon=12, order=None, seasonal=False, seasonal_period=12)[source]

Forecast using ARIMA model.

Parameters:

  • series (Series) – Univariate time series with a DateTimeIndex.

  • horizon (int) – Forecast horizon.

  • order (Optional[Tuple[int, int, int]]) – Optional ARIMA (p,d,q) order. If None, uses auto_arima.

  • seasonal (bool) – Whether to include seasonal ARIMA terms.

  • seasonal_period (int) – The seasonal period if seasonal is True.

Return type:

Series

Returns:

Forecasted pandas Series with horizon steps.

TimesFM Forecasting

TimesFM (Time Series Foundation Model) integration for decline curve forecasting.

decline_analysis.forecast_timesfm.forecast_timesfm(series, horizon=12)[source]

Generate forecasts using Google’s TimesFM model.

Parameters: - series: Historical production data - horizon: Number of periods to forecast

Returns: - Forecasted production series

Return type:

Series

decline_analysis.forecast_timesfm.check_timesfm_availability()[source]

Check if TimesFM dependencies are available.

Return type:

bool

Chronos Forecasting

Chronos (Amazon’s time series foundation model) integration for decline curve forecasting.

decline_analysis.forecast_chronos.forecast_chronos(series, horizon=12)[source]

Generate forecasts using Amazon’s Chronos model.

Parameters: - series: Historical production data - horizon: Number of periods to forecast

Returns: - Forecasted production series

Return type:

Series

decline_analysis.forecast_chronos.forecast_chronos_probabilistic(series, horizon=12, quantiles=[0.1, 0.5, 0.9])[source]

Generate probabilistic forecasts using Chronos-style approach.

Parameters: - series: Historical production data - horizon: Number of periods to forecast - quantiles: List of quantiles to generate

Returns: - DataFrame with forecast quantiles

Return type:

DataFrame

decline_analysis.forecast_chronos.check_chronos_availability()[source]

Check if Chronos dependencies are available.

Return type:

bool
